page.title: 18November the Fifth
page.content: Every year on November 5th there is a bonfire and lots of fireworks in Stand Road Park. The fire is built & super- vised by firemen in an effort to enco- urage people to attend rather than to build their own bonfires at home which are usually responsible for so many accidents each year. The bonfire is very large and thousands of people attend the spectacle. On the top of the fire is placed an effigy of Guy Fawkes who burns to loud cheers from the crowd. The firemen provide a very colourful firework display and there are vans where hot food and soup can be bought. It does not cost anything to attend the bonfire but voluntary contributions are taken and donated to charity. Also in the park at this time as a further attraction there is a travelling fair where people can go on rides and try to win prizes.
